author: Michelle Devani
title: 23 Healing Ways to Bring Back Love in A Dying Relationship
text:
A relationship can end up in a great long lasting happiness and peacefulness. But sometimes it can end badly too. Before the relationship goes to end, why not do something that might save it?
Love is the base of every good relationship. When a relationship crumbles, it is mostly because the love is gone. So to salvage the relationship here are unexpected ways to bring back love in a dying relationship:
Remember The Good Old Times Sit together and remember the good times in your relationship. You can do this by taking a look at photos of a certain moment, telling stories, or other ways. This will remind both of you of the love that have always been in this relationship
Surprise Your Partner Surprise your partner now and then by giving them something they like or doing anything out of the ordinary that might surprise them. Doing this will spice the relationship up.
Get To Know Your Partner Having the patience and will to get to know your partner restate the signs that a man loves you unconditionally you have for your partner. This will make love spread in the air.
Love Yourself The bad quality of love comes from someone who lacks love from themselves inside. That is why to truly improve the quality of your love, you need to first love yourself. You can do this with daily self care, self encouragement and many more
Go Outside From The Usual Environment Monotonous environment can tire oneself. That is why it is probably good to go out from the usual environment. You can do this by travelling or spending quality time together outside.
Open Up More Vulnerability is one of a great base of a strong realtionship. Open up mor towards your partner. Doing this will not only bond you but it also reminds your partner that you trust him/her and that you love him/ her
Be Closer Be physically closer by casually holding your partner‚Äôs hands, cuddling, kissing, and many more. Show the Physical Signs A Woman Likes You Like Crazy . Your partner will get a hint and start to grow a more passionate love towards you
Pay More Attention Pay more attention towards your partner by intently listening and just watching your partner compassionately. Attention will make your partner feel wanted and they will do the same to you to. The result is a new romantic relationship.
Be Patient The result do not come in a second. Being patient with the relationship and your partner will show through your action. This trait will be seen by your partner and he/ she will be grateful and develop a feeling towards you more.
Vent Let it all out by venting towards each other without pushing the relationship towards the end. Find a way to let off the steam and the burdening thoughts that have been weighing your chest.
Find New Couples Being social actually helps to boost up your mood. That is why finding a couple you can communicate with might help. They might help with your problem or just making you guys relaxed. Its a great Ways to Bring Back the Love in Your Relationship
Have Some Space Having some space might sound like a scary thing to do but it is absolutely the best ways to bring back love in a dying relationship. This is because being bored towards each other is natural, so some space is always appreciated.
Contents
More Tips to Bring Back Love in a Old Relationship More great ways to rejuvenate your dying relationship with this romantic tips:
Give Gifts ‚ÄìGive thoughtful gifts towards your partner so that they will feel surprised and happy Limit Forces From The Outside ‚ÄìStop thinking about the outside world and try to stop the connection. This will help you focus on just the relationship. Find An Outlet To Let Go ‚ÄìFind a great outlet to let all the burden go. This can be by making something Find Help ‚ÄìFinding help is absolutely neccessary when you feel like the relationship is really crumbling. Do this by going to a trusted person, friend, or a professional Talk It Through ‚Äì Talk the problem through with each other. Find a quiet space and a long time to peacefully and safely talk about the road blocks in your relationship. Then you can work together to solve the problem. This shows you don‚Äôt have the Signs of Conditional Love Do Something New Together ‚ÄìFind new things that you guys have not done. This new activity will bond you guys closer, make new memories, and bring a new found happiness towards your relationship Second First Date ‚Äì A second first date lets you ‚Äòstart all over again‚Äô Signs that the Relationship is Salvaged All these tips and ways took so much time and of course you are dying to know if it all works out. So here are the real signs that the relationship is salvaged
Mutual Effort ‚Äì You both try to make each other happy, making the relationship work, and doing other things to make the love survive Admiration Towards Each Other ‚Äì You admire your partner with all your heart and your partner does the same Saying I love You ‚Äì Loving partner always find ways to say I love you without saying I love you. Imagining The Future ‚Äì You feel like your partner have Signs He is Your Real Soulmate for A Lifetime therefore you imagine a future together It is hard to see when a relationship is dying in front of your eyes. But do not worry, you can absolutely do something about it. That is why you need to follow the guidelines on tips and ways to bring back love in a dying relationship. After that, sit back and realize that the Signs That Someone is In Love With You is resurfacing.

author: Anita-Corbo
title: Your Favorite Emoji ‚ù§
text:
Your Favorite Emoji ‚ù§
Dear Mommy,
I'm trying to cheer you up today so I hope you appreciate the GIF I made for you.
I found a scratch-off at the lotto kiosk with your favorite emoji‚Ä¶
The heart. ‚ù§
It's called ‚ÄúQueen of Hearts.‚Äù
Daddy is helping me scratch it off.
Wouldn't the world be a more wonderful place if we could all have that as our favorite emoji?
I'm sorry if I don't win anything on it but I hope it helped you smile & laugh a little bit.
It only cost $5.00.
But even if 5 bucks helped you giggle a little today, it will have been worth it!
Maybe this will be stupid or dumb to others when they read it, but making you feel joy in your heart again is more important to me than what others think.
BTW, I just want you to know that I never thought you were stupid or dumb or ugly or whatever it is that mean people always call you.
It's just that you happen to be a little different, that's all.
Maybe some people don't understand what the word different means‚Ä¶ üíÅ
Love you the MOSTEST,
Your son,
CUZZY

author: VNExplorer
title: Real estate billionaire Barry Sternlicht says rents will rise in two years‚Äîand it‚Äôs Jerome Powell‚Äôs fault
text: Barry Sternlicht, chief executive officer of Starwood Capital Group. Starwood Capital Group‚Äôs chief executive and chairman doesn‚Äôt seem to be a fan of the Federal Reserve. The billionaire behind the real estate investment firm, Barry Sternlicht, has mocked and blamed the institution and its chair, Jerome Powell, on several occasions. Sternlicht once called the Fed, ‚ÄúJay Powell and his merry band of lunatics,‚Äù in an interview with Fortune, claiming there‚Äôd be ‚Äúsocial unrest‚Äù because of its monetary tightening. On another occasion, he called the Fed‚Äôs interest rate hikes ‚Äúself-inflicted suicide.‚Äù And of course, some of his angst could have to do with the impact rate increases may have had on his own business, which has invested in and managed billions in real estate assets during the past three decades In an interview with CNBC yesterday, Sternlicht didn‚Äôt change his tune, although he was less colorful. ‚ÄúThis is my problem with Powell,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúHis policy has now crushed multifamily starts; we need houses.‚Äù Sternlicht continued: ‚ÄúSo with only 220,000 houses coming in [2026], I will guarantee you rents will go up in ‚Äô26, unless there‚Äôs a massive recession.‚Äù Essentially, he‚Äôs suggesting that fewer apartments will be built in the coming years because of increased cost and risk, which then means rents will go up because it‚Äôll only worsen an already existing housing shortage. The country is missing millions of homes, and it‚Äôs partly why home prices haven‚Äôt fallen, despite skyrocketing mortgage rates and depressed sales activity. When it comes to rents, which along with home prices rose throughout the pandemic-fueled housing boom, they‚Äôve sort of flatlined. But, in some places, they‚Äôve dropped because of a recent boom in multifamily construction: According to Redfin, ‚Äúthe Sunbelt is seeing some of the biggest rent declines in America.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe Sun Belt has built a ton of new apartments in recent years, partly to meet the surge in demand brought on by the flood of people who moved in during the pandemic housing boom. But the boom is over, and now property owners are struggling to fill vacancies, which is causing rents to fall,‚Äù Redfin Senior Economist Sheharyar Bokhari said last month. ‚ÄúThe good news is that the uptick in housing supply in the Sun Belt has improved affordability for renters, which can be a lesson for other American cities grappling with housing affordability challenges.‚Äù Still, some suggest this is a temporary phenomenon, similar to what Sternlicht is arguing. And again, this weakness in multifamily homes isn‚Äôt great for investors, who are often blamed online for the housing crisis. But it is good for typical Americans. When the Fed began raising interest rates to tame inflation, it sent a shock to commercial real estate, and multifamily. Values that rode the money waves of the pandemic plummeted, and loans are maturing in an environment where rents have cooled off and interest rates are much higher. There could be more pain ahead for all commercial real estate, and it still feels as though the entire sector is at a standstill. ‚ÄúTransaction volumes across the world are still down 70%,‚Äù Sternlicht said. ‚ÄúThere are no trades. So the only one who‚Äôs trading is a mortgage coming due, and if they can‚Äôt find somebody to rescue them, they‚Äôll sell it.‚Äù And banks don‚Äôt want a non-performing mortgage, so they sell, too, he said, referring to short sales. Every time there‚Äôs a crisis, said Sternlicht, there‚Äôs a disconnect in what buyers are asking for and what sellers want. Sellers want to bargain and buyers want yesterday‚Äôs prices, Sternlicht explained. But that gap has shrunk. ‚ÄúThe spreads are coming in, which means the markets are healing‚Äîthe future is getting clearer, particularly for apartments,‚Äù he said. This story was originally featured on Fortune.com

author: Owen Sexton / owen@chronline.com
title: Vietnam veteran‚Äôs Medal of Honor to be permanently displayed at Veterans Memorial Museum in Chehalis | The Daily Chronicle
text: Franklin D. Miller, or ‚ÄúDean,‚Äù as he was known to his unit during the Vietnam War, was a U.S. Army command sergeant major who was awarded the Medal of Honor on June 5, 1971, by former President Richard Nixon. He was given the Medal of Honor for his actions during a battle on Jan. 5, 1970, while deployed in Vietnam, Veterans Memorial Museum Executive Director Chip Duncan said. Now, 54 years to the day after the battle, Miller‚Äôs Medal of Honor will be delivered by his daughter, Danielle Keller, of Portland, during a ceremony to the Veterans Memorial Museum in Chehalis, where it will be permanently displayed. The ceremony will begin at 1 p.m. on Jan. 5, 2024, at the museum, located at 100 SW Veterans Way in Chehalis. Along with Keller, the ceremony will also feature Skip Ettinger, a lifelong friend of Miller‚Äôs; retired U.S. Army Colonel Rick Thomas, former commander of the 1st Special Forces Group at Fort Lewis; and U.S. Army Master Sergeant Earl Plumlee, who was awarded the Medal of Honor for actions while deployed in Afghanistan in 2013. ‚ÄúSkip is here in Washington state, and he learned that Danielle was, instead of leaving it in a closet or a box, looking for a place to display the Medal of Honor,‚Äú Duncan told The Chronicle on Dec. 28. Duncan has been working with Keller and Ettinger for three years in an effort to get a display set up for Miller‚Äôs Medal of Honor. Miller, a staff sergeant and a member of the U.S. Army‚Äôs 5th Special Forces Group at the time, specialized in reconnaissance patrols. On Jan. 5, 1970, he was a team leader for a joint American-Vietnamese unit on a long-range reconnaissance patrol deep within enemy territory. After leaving a helicopter intersection point on the patrol, one of Miller‚Äôs unit members tripped an explosive enemy booby trap, wounding four members of his patrol. Miller quickly administered first aid and moved his unit into a defensible position, as he knew the explosion alerted nearby Vietcong fighters. Once his unit was secure in a defensible position, Miller went out alone to face what he estimated to be a platoon-sized enemy force ‚Äî between 20 and 50 soldiers ‚Äî approaching his unit‚Äôs position. He single-handedly repulsed two initial enemy attacks before rejoining his unit and calling for a helicopter extraction for his men. However, the only suitable extraction point was a bomb crater some 150 meters from his unit‚Äôs position. Miller scouted a route to the crater and led his men through the jungle to it, but as the helicopter hovered over the crater to extract them, the Vietcong launched another attack against Miller‚Äôs unit, causing the helicopter to leave. The enemy‚Äôs attack continued, leaving Miller heavily wounded. Only two other men in his patrol survived. Despite the Vietcong‚Äôs persistence, Miller continued to repel enemy advances until a friendly relief force reached their position to provide assistance. ‚ÄúMiller's gallantry, intrepidity in action, and selfless devotion to the welfare of his comrades are in keeping with the highest traditions of the military service and reflect great credit on him, his unit, and the U.S. Army,‚Äù reads Miller‚Äôs Medal of Honor citation. Miller died June 30, 2000, in Florida. Those looking to learn more about Miller can read his book, ‚ÄúReflections of a Warrior: Six Years as a Green Beret in Vietnam,‚Äù available from Amazon and other online retailers. Learn more about Miller at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Miller.

author: Steve Weinman
title: 44% of reef-building corals now at risk
text:
No fewer than 44% of reef-building coral species are at risk of global extinction, according to the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species, which has announced the results of its global assessment at the COP29 UN climate conference in Azerbaijan.

The International Union for Conservation of Nature & Natural Resources has assessed the conservation status of 892 warmwater reef-building coral species for its Red List , which is currently marking its 60th anniversary. The last such assessment was carried out 16 years ago, when around 33% of corals were considered under threat.

“As world leaders gather at the UN climate conference in Baku, this global coral assessment vividly illustrates the severe impacts of our rapidly changing climate on life on Earth and drives home the severity of the consequences,” said IUCN director-general Dr Grethel Aguilar.\xa0

“Healthy ecosystems like coral reefs are essential for human livelihoods – providing food, stabilising coastlines and storing carbon. The protection of our biodiversity is not only vital for our well-being but crucial for our survival.\xa0

“Climate change remains the leading threat to reef-building corals and is devastating the natural systems we depend on. We must take bold, decisive action to cut greenhouse gas emissions if we are to secure a sustainable future for humanity.”

 Reef in Raja Ampat (IUCN Picture Library / Jason Suwandy) 
The findings were based on the most recent status update from the Global Coral Reef Monitoring Network ( GCRMN ) alongside current and future threats such as the projected increase in warming and major bleaching events, using Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) data.

In addition to climate change and related severe bleaching events, other threats to coral health include pollution, agricultural run-off, disease and unsustainable fishing.

 Staghorn and elkhorn 
The IUCN offered as examples staghorn ( Acropora cervicornis ) and elkhorn coral ( A palmata ), Critically Endangered species in the Caribbean that had experienced significant declines because of increased warming, water pollution, hurricanes and the severe impacts of coral diseases.

 Elkhorn coral – Critically Endangered in the Caribbean (MSC) 
The main solutions for saving corals from extinction are cutting greenhouse-gas emissions and actions to strengthen species’ resilience. The assessors also recommend more research into whether and how corals can adapt to warmer waters, with evidence of adaptation limited so far.

“We’ve known for decades that coral reefs are on the frontline of the global climate and biodiversity crises, and this new result only reconfirms this,” said Dr David Obura, co-chair of the IUCN SSC Coral Specialist Group.

“Without relevant decisions from those with the power to change this trajectory, we will see the further loss of reefs and progressive disappearance of coral species at larger and larger scales.”\xa0

 Coldwater corals 
The majority of corals are found across the Indo-Pacific but the global assessment of reef-building corals also includes 85 Atlantic species highlighted recently in a PLOS One journal article, these being particularly highly threatened by severe annual bleaching events, pollution and disease.

 
 
 
Red List assessments of coldwater corals are ongoing, with only 22 species of a total of 4,000+ having been assessed so far. The main threats to these species include bottom trawling, deep-sea mining, oil and gas drilling\xa0 and deep-sea cable-laying, with white coral ( Desmophyllum pertusum ) one example of a species assessed as Vulnerable.\xa0

“The latest global assessment brings troubling news for corals, with more than 340 species now being considered at risk of extinction,” said MSC Foundation chief science advisor Prof David Smith.

“An ocean without functioning coral reefs would be a bleak reality, highlighting the urgent need to find solutions to the climate crisis while simultaneously addressing today’s coral crisis.”

author: AFP and Redacci√≥n 24 Horas
title: El juicio por el robo de joyas de Kim Kardashian se realizar√° en 2025
text:
En 2016 la socialit√©, Kim Kardashian sufri√≥ de un robo millonario de joyer√≠a en Francia. 12 personas han sido detenidas y el juicio ser√° en 2025.
Las fechas del juicio se realizar√°n del 28 de abril al 23 de mayo de 2025 de acuerdo a un documento emitido a abogados.
De acuerdo a la informaci√≥n este robo es el m√°s grande cometido en el pa√≠s contra una persona en dos d√©cadas.
Por si te lo perdiste:
Aprender a escribir desde la estabilidad: Daniela Spalla
En la madrugada del 3 de octubre de 2016, varios hombres, algunos vestidos de polic√≠a, entraron en la residencia de lujo en la que se alojaba Kardashian en Par√≠s, con motivo de la Semana de la Moda.
Los hombres le robaron joyas valoradas en m√°s de seis millones de d√≥lares y que, en su mayor√≠a, nunca se encontraron.
Dos de los asaltantes le pusieron pistolas en la sien y uno de ellos, seg√∫n el relato de Kardashian a la polic√≠a, se dirigi√≥ a ella en ingl√©s con ‚Äúun fuerte acento franc√©s‚Äù y le dijo que se quitara un anillo que llevaba.
Despu√©s de eso, la amarraron y amordazaron, y la encerraron en el cuarto de ba√±o.
Por si te lo perdiste:
Julianne Moore y Tilda Swinton a protagonizar ‚ÄúLa habitaci√≥n de al lado‚Äù, la nueva cinta de Pedro Almod√≥var
Entretanto, tres hombres montaban guardia en la recepci√≥n y otro esperaba delante del edificio, dentro de un auto.
Diez presuntos miembros del grupo ser√°n juzgados por el atraco o el secuestro de Kim Kardashian, otro hombre deber√° responder por otro proyecto criminal y el duod√©cimo por un delito vinculado a la legislaci√≥n sobre armas.
LDAV

author: Jaylenne Zece√±a
title: MCN denuncia al STEG de ¬´secuestrar¬ª la educaci√≥n por intereses sindicales
text:
El Movimiento C√≠vico Nacional (MCN) expres√≥ su rechazo ante la suspensi√≥n de actividades educativas en Guatemala, como consecuencia de medidas impulsadas por el Sindicato de Trabajadores de la Educaci√≥n de Guatemala (STEG). La organizaci√≥n se√±al√≥ que estas acciones afectan de manera directa a miles de estudiantes y comprometen la calidad del sistema educativo nacional.
En un comunicado difundido este mi√©rcoles 25 de junio, el MCN sostuvo que la educaci√≥n ha sido ‚Äútomada como reh√©n‚Äù para asegurar privilegios sindicales, dejando de lado el derecho al aprendizaje de los ni√±os y j√≥venes guatemaltecos.
CUESTIONAN FALTA DE TRANSPARENCIA El MCN tambi√©n reiter√≥ sus cr√≠ticas al pacto colectivo negociado entre el STEG y el Ministerio de Educaci√≥n (Mineduc), al cual calific√≥ como un acuerdo ‚Äúopaco‚Äù que favorece intereses particulares por encima del bien com√∫n. Seg√∫n el movimiento, este pacto incluye privilegios que impactan negativamente la calidad educativa y ha sido negociado bajo condiciones de confidencialidad, impidiendo la supervisi√≥n ciudadana.
A trav√©s de su iniciativa #DestapandoElPacto, el MCN asegur√≥ haber documentado diversos abusos sindicales, los cuales, afirman, afectan a estudiantes, docentes y a la administraci√≥n p√∫blica en general.
En medio de presi√≥n, sindicato de Joviel arremete contra trabajo de La Hora
PIDEN QUE PACTOS SEAN P√öBLICOS Y SUJETOS A CONTROL Ante esta situaci√≥n, el Movimiento C√≠vico Nacional exigi√≥ que todos los pactos colectivos y negociaciones que involucren recursos del Estado sean p√∫blicos, accesibles y sujetos a evaluaciones de calidad del gasto, como mecanismo para fortalecer la institucionalidad democr√°tica y garantizar el derecho a la informaci√≥n.
‚ÄúSolo as√≠ podremos construir una verdadera Rep√∫blica, en la que las instituciones respondan a los derechos ciudadanos‚Äù, se√±ala el comunicado. Finalmente, el MCN hizo un llamado a priorizar la educaci√≥n como un derecho fundamental, y no como una herramienta de presi√≥n sindical.
üì¢ANTE LA OPINI√ìN P√öBLICA MANIFESTAMOS: pic.twitter.com/UzWvr1cqZT
‚Äî Movimiento C√≠vico Nacional (@MCNGuatemala) June 25, 2025

author: Luke Dammann
title: "A Christmas Miracle," Universal Studios Icon Returns to Orlando - Inside the Magic
text: The Universal Studios resort in Florida has received a major upgrade just in time for Christmas. Related: [Multiple Disney Parks Hit Capacity, Guests Turned Away on Christmas](https://insidethemagic.net/2023/12/multiple-disney-parks-hit-capacity-guests-turned-away-on-christmas-ld1/) The Universal Orlando Resort is famous for a lot of things, but the most famous image fans have of this destination and company, in general, may just be the iconic globe at the front of the parks. Universal‚Äôs spinning globe is one of the most iconic logos and branding images in the entire world, making it a no-brainer to include it at the actual Universal Studios theme parks. The Universal Globe stands tall amongst other Florida landmarks like Cinderella Castle at [Magic Kingdom](https://insidethemagic.net/2023/06/a-comprehensive-guide-to-disneys-magic-kingdom-park-lh1/). Unfortunately, the globe outside of the Universal Orlando Resort was shut off for necessary maintenance. Thankfully, this globe has been restored and is spinning once again. You can take a look at the globe in action thanks to a clip from avid theme park photographer bioreconstruct: A Christmas miracle! The Universal globe is spinning again! Was in refurbishment for several weeks. [pic.twitter.com/XFjs4Ff9uU](https://t.co/XFjs4Ff9uU) ‚Äî bioreconstruct (@bioreconstruct) [December 25, 2023](https://twitter.com/bioreconstruct/status/1739400615992734066?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) bioreconstruct referred to this as a ‚ÄúChristmas miracle,‚Äù and we honestly have to agree with them. This massive globe is the first thing guests see and think of when they hear Universal Studios, so first impressions here are incredibly important. As they stated in the original tweet, the globe was in refurbishment for several weeks, and we honestly were not sure when or if it would return to its former glory. But we‚Äôre glad that it‚Äôs finally back at the resort, and on Christmas day, no less! Related: [Multiple Netflix Series Bury ‚ÄòStranger Things‚Äô, New List Confirms Replacements](https://insidethemagic.net/2023/12/multiple-series-netflix-series-bury-stranger-things-new-list-confirms-replacements-ad1/) The Universal Orlando Resort is home to some truly remarkable and unique experiences, ranging from frightening thrill rides like VelociCoaster to iconic and historic attractions such as Jurassic Park River Adventure. The resort features two exciting theme parks, Universal Studios Florida and Universal‚Äôs Islands of Adventure, both of which allow guests to immerse themselves in some of the best theme park experiences in the country, let alone the state of Florida. This resort is Walt Disney World‚Äôs biggest competition, bringing in millions of guests every year. It ranks in the same popularity as Disney‚Äôs Animal Kingdom, [EPCOT](https://insidethemagic.net/2023/05/an-epcot-park-guide-for-first-time-visitors-ktc1/), and Disney‚Äôs Hollywood Studios, only being beaten by the Magic Kingdom. But this may all soon change when Epic Universe officially opens. This massive expansion will act as the third theme park at the resort and will feature some truly incredible new rides, attractions, locations, and experiences for guests to enjoy. Among these new locations will be SUPER NINTENDO WORLD, as well as an entire land dedicated to the How To Train Your Dragon franchise. Epic Universe is set to open sometime in 2025, and we can‚Äôt wait to finally experience it. For more information regarding Epic Universe in Orlando, Florida, [click here](https://insidethemagic.net/2022/01/universal-epic-universe-taking-shape-ab1/) to see our coverage. What‚Äôs your favorite ride or attraction at the Universal Orlando Resort? Are you excited about Epic Universe opening up?
